p: S. sylvatica L. (hedge woundwort) is an erect and hirsute perennial found in shady spots in woodland, forests, roadsides, alpine meadows, and grasslands, growing up to 120 cm. It differs from marsh woundwort in habitat preference, the broader leaves, and its characteristic, unpleasant smell when crushed, but the two can hybridise where they co-exist [ 2, 3, 10, 11] [ Figure 6].
